Package client

Class CheckCirclesAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
client.CheckCirclesAlgorithm
Direct Known Subclasses:
CheckCirclesRecursively, CheckFirstCircles
public abstract class CheckCirclesAlgorithm extends Object
CheckCirclesAlgorithm is a class that executes the algorithm, which changes the color of the fields to which the given checker can move.

    • checkCircles

      public void checkCircles(CircleTree circleTree, int x, int y, int a)
      Changes the color of the fields that the checker can jump onto from the given field and adds them to the tree.
      Parameters:
      circleTree - the tree node which corresponds to the given field.
      x - the value of the first coordinate of the key to which the given field is assigned.
      y - the value of the second coordinate of the key to which the given field is assigned.
      a - the value which ensures that appropriate circles are checked.

    • isOnTheBoard

      public boolean isOnTheBoard(int x, int y)
      Checks whether a circle with given coordinates exists.
      Parameters:
      x - the value of the first coordinate of the circle.
      y - the value of the second coordinate of the circle.
      Returns:
      true, if the circle exists, false otherwise.

    • checkCircleIfWhite

      public boolean checkCircleIfWhite(CircleTree circleTree, int x, int y, boolean b)
      Checks whether a given circle is white and checks it.
      Parameters:
      circleTree - the tree node which corresponds to the given field.
      x - the value of the first coordinate of the circle.
      y - the value of the second coordinate of the circle.
      b - true, if the previous circle is in target triangle, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true, if the given circle is white, false otherwise.

      public boolean inTargetTriangle(int x, int y)

      y - the value of the second coordinate of the circle.
      Returns:
